page.title: 15ECOLOGY, FLORA, ASHBY MAGNA
page.content: The major land uses of the area produce 3 major habitat types: mixed grassland, hedgerows and small mixed woodlands, and rough pasture/woodland type on the disused airfield. Unfortunately the relatively intensive land use means that there are field species living in the grassland and that although lapwing are common other plovers are less so. The hedgerows are however well preserved and small coppices maintained to provide habitat for foxes. The major tree species since the death of many elms with Dutch elm disease is now ash. There few oaks and willows and beech is found around Peatling Parva. The hedges usually contain many species; hawthorn, blackthorn, field maple, ash, willow and hazel.
